characters: AUDREY WILL YOU SHUT THE FUCK UP

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. NIGHTCLUB- EVENING
dialogues.text: A disembodied gaggle of jersey clad shoulders, jeans, and hats crosses a narrow street. Lights flare, hands are stamped, torsos are patted down. Money exchanges hands. W descend into a black, throbbing tunnel. Explicit music booms from bassy club speakers.   Hips, le feet dancing. A GO-GO DANCER struts and wiggles around a brass pole. and cheers. The dancer marches in place, rolling her thonged bottom. More cheers, greedy hands stuff dollars into her waistban

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Where all my sexy Sagittarian ladies at? Arms go up.   A collection of whoops ripple the crowd. The dancer wraps her legs around the pole and oozes upwar headfirst. The CAMERA ROTATES as she stretches her booted heels into the crowd. We realize that she has been dancin on the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! ALIKE (pronounced AH-LEE-KAY), 17, covers her mouth, laug and wide-eyed. She tries to back away from the stage, but pushed forward by a torrent of eager arms waving dollar bills. Among them is LAURA, 18, worldly and smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where your singles at?!! Where your singles at?!! Yeah, baby! Laura strains over Alike's shoulder to tuck a bill into t dancer's boot. Alike drops her beer in all the jostling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn I love my job! Laura stuffs a bill into Alike's now empty hand and forci waves Alike's wrist in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike pulls free just as the dancer takes notice and begi to direct her attention at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Chill!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatchu' come here for?! Alike shoves the dollar bill into Laura's chest and shoul her way past the wall of onlookers surrounding the stage. Laura shrugs, puts the bill in her teeth and lays her hea the edge of the stage. Alike looks away and breaks throug snarl of clubgoers just as the dancer begins to descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Sorry. Excuse me. Oof, sorry ladies. Finally free of the throng, Alike takes a breath and look the clock on her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! She rolls her eyes back to the stage where Laura is no lo visible. Not daring to risk another plunge into the throb crowd, she retreats for the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: INT. NIGHTCLUB BAR- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Alike beaches at an empty spot at the bar. Her gaze settl on a CUTE GIRL a little ways down, staring out at the dan floor. Alike jerks her eyes away and smooths the front of shirt and adjusts her hat as she edges toward the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. The girl ignores her. Alike clears her throat and speaks little too loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm... Hey! How are you?! The girl jerks around and frowns at Alike, looking her up down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm...sorry. I was just sayin' Umm...hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. The girl dismisses Alike and turns back toward the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You wanna drink or something? Hey! Hey! Over here! Alike strains, snapping at the bartender. A CONFIDENT WOM swaggers up close to the girl and extends her hand. The c girl takes it and allows herself to be lead to the dance floor. Alike looks around just in time to see her leaving The bartender finally materializes, and Alike slinks away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike slumps into a long line of women waiting to squeeze cramped, 2 stall bathroom. A COUPLE in front of her makes vigorously, and she folds her arms and looks away. A buff 30-SOMETHING WOMAN with locs smiles and winks at Alike. Alike smiles and fidgets with her eyebrows and loo away. The line inches forward. Alike glances around searching for the woman. The 30-something has already los interest, her attention now fully directed at a much more FEMININE WOMAN strutting out of the restroom. Embarrassed Alike faces front again. Two androgynous gangsters (AGs) have witnessed the whole thing nudge each other and sneer Alike squares her shoulders and widens her stance. One of the AG's breaks out in laughter and they turn around as t line inches forward again. Alike pretends not to notice a slumps out of line and retreats for a lonely oasis of cou along the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike dozes on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up for Sin-A-Min ladies!! Alike wakes with a start. She checks the time on her cell phone. Cursing, she scrambles up from the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura dances with a cute SHORT HAIRED GIRL. Alike spots the pair from afar and heads in their directi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, we're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, why you trippin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you trippin', you know I gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I gotta go.   I'ma get in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme dance with shortie first, then I'll be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Laura spins the short haired on the dance floor and the p continue their wobbling, uneven groove. Alike endures sev moments of invisibility as a sea of women, both "feminine and "butch" push past her without a second glance. Alike at Laura's jersey. Laura, happily tangled in her dance partner's embrace rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop pulling on my clothes!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BUS STOP- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Laura sulks, frowning out at the night. Alike extends the olive branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many numbers you get? One?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could've gotten more, but your moms was holding me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh.   That's jacked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many you get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonya, Denise, Shelley. No wait that's old, I can delete that one. Tonya... Laura snatches the phone from Alike. Alike swipes at it b misses. Laura fends her off with one hand and scrolls thr the numbers with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't Shelley that chick from your math class?! Denise... What? These are your damn study group numbers! Why you frontin'?! Alike snatches the phone and wipes the screen with her sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see you with no list of numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the one looking for a girlfriend, man. You the one still a virgin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to help your ass. I'm sayin', whatchu waitin' for?! Alike shrugs it off, her smile fading a little. Laura elb her and sneers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kickin' that same `ol quiet shit since 6th grade. I don't need to press, I gets plenty. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wah-wah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get more pussy than your daddy, nigga, what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!! Yeah, you got me with that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike becomes more quiet and less playful as the ride wea on. A middle-class Bronx landscape, well-lit with a newly constructed Starbucks and renovated condos flits by the window. Alike reaches over and presses the tape. Laura el Alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your stop-- you're getting off here, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'll roll with you a few more stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you gon' walk all the way back down for? That's stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you get home okay. The bus pulls to the curb. The light flicks on over the b door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't big, nigga. Trying to protect somebody. Hurry up, man, get off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to bus driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright man--next stop. Next stop! Alike elbows Laura sharply. The bus driver frowns in the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't gotta push me, why're you beastin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not beastin'. Laura climbs over Alike and swings toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem. Call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'ma call you. Alike turns and watches Laura stroll away. Laura drums a little beat on Alike's window as the bus pulls off. Alike waves and faces forward again. An OLD LADY sitting nearby shoots her a disapproving look. Alike rolls her eyes and moves to a seat farther away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike studies her reflection in the window, and takes a breath. She unbuttons her bulky men's shirt to reveal a fitting baby doll shirt that reads "Princess." She stuffs her baseball cap and durag into her backpack and jabs a p of small gold hoop earrings into her ears. She slumps bac against the seat and stares into the night. The bus stops at a lonely island of curb. Alike is a dark silhouette sprinting around the corner and into the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike cracks open the front door just wide enough to slip through. The house is dark except for the flashing microw clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike takes off her sneakers and pads down the hallway. H younger sister, SHARONDA's door cracks open as she passes SHARONDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You late. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Be quiet. SHARONDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been this late? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Movies. SHARONDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movie ended at midnight. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shhh. Shut up. Alike shoves her sister and tries to close the door. Shar yanks the door open wider. SHARONDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Don't push me. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Go to bed. SHARONDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what stays open past midnight. Sharonda puts a hand to her head and does a little dance. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Alike eases Sharonda's door shut.     Sharonda swings the open wide. SHARONDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night Lee! Sharonda slams her door.      The light clicks on underne Alike's parent's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee? Lee?! Alike rolls her eyes at her sister's closed door and shru into her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike rushes to shove her stuffed backpack under the bed. She tosses her shoes in the closet just as her mother, AU appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to know you still live here. Alike peels off her socks and slumps on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing home so late, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost track of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what time your curfew is. Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The show ended at midnight. And your curfew is twelve thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost track of time. Audrey gets cozy in the doorjamb.      Alike turns her ba her and slumps into pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you were cute. Where'd you get that shirt? `Princess'. I like that. Alike winds the princess shirt around her fist and launch to the top of the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compliments your figure. I saw something just like it on sale, maybe we could go shopping--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight. Audrey stiffens and pulls her robe tighter. Vinegar repla honey in her demeanor as the warmth drains out of her voi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't care for that young lady you run around with anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tie your head up. Alike snags a satin headscarf from the nightstand and sla it around her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your head. And you really should wash your face, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have on make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wash your face anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. I'm seventeen years old, please don't talk to me like--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your tone. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's your skin. Audrey leaves. Alike is still. She listens for the door t her parent's room to shut before snatching off the scarf storming to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike turns on the faucet, wets the soap and puts it back the dish, wets her wash cloth and puts it back on the rac She plops down on the toilet and looks up. A crucifix fro down at her from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She averts her eyes and stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you brush your teeth? Alike wets her toothbrush and throws it back into the hol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee? Alike squeezes out a dollop of toothpaste and smears a li around the sink. She stares at her reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee? Alike flicks water droplets at the mirror for good measur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike, bundled in an oversized hoodie edges up to the perimeter of campus and waits against a bus shelter. STUD horseplay and mill about the entrance in groups, chugging their morning Fantas and munching on snack cakes. The sch bell rings and the lawn slowly empties into the building. Alike shifts her weight and checks her watch as the last STRAGGLERS finally trickle in. She yanks her hoodie tight and launches across the lawn and into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second school bell sounds and the din of slamming locke and jubilant chatter dies to a hush as students shuffle i classrooms. Alike cracks the back stairwell door and peek out into the mostly empty hallway before tearing for the bathroom. One last straggler BINA, a 17 year-old girl wit mature, but down-to-earth good looks rushes past Alike. T two exchange a brief, confused look then mutually dismiss each other as they hurry in opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike hurtles into the handicapped stall and snaps it shu behind her. She rips off her hoodie and the "girly" shirt beneath and flings them to the floor. She pulls out a pai wife-beaters from her bag and pulls them over her head. S unwads a polo shirt and yanks it over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at her reflection in the window and tries unsuccessfully to smooth her shirt. Her eyes scour her reflection again and again for any imperfections. She spo the earrings and yanks them out of her ears. The late bel beckons and Alike stuffs her "feminine" clothes into her backpack and bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MATH TEACHER glides up and down the aisles passing ou graded tests. A chorus of groans follows in her wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As promised, I will be grading these on a curve. Alike is folded into the backmost corner of the classroom The desks in front her and beside her are empty. She is ignored as the rest of the class chatters and passes note

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the highest grade on the test was a 98. The math teacher puts Alike's test on her desk and gives a little smile. Alike doesn't smile back. The lunch bell rings and the class is a tornado, clearing room in a rush of limbs, shouts, and backpacks. Alike jab her headphones into her ears and packs her bag very deliberately, letting the eye of the storm pass over her before heading toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cafeteria is a whirl of activity and social jockeying Clusters of girls and boys loud-talk, flirt, fight and horseplay at tables and in tight little groups against th walls. Alike walks alone, staying at the fringes of the c and shrugs through the cafeteria line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike flees the cafeteria, tray laden with rubbery cuisin dubious nutritional value. She raps on the door of a classroom and slips in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! MRS. ALVARADO, a middle aged Californian ex-hippie type reclines with her feet on her desk, munching on celery st and sunflower seed paste. Her small desk radio plays alternative rock. Sun beams into the empty classroom and Alike squints as she yanks the headphones out of her ears pulls up a chair next to her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddja bring me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' you can eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be eatin' that crap, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over a mouthful of pizza)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooo, where's the new stuff? Alike hands over her purple and white composition book. M Alvarado thumbs the pages, reading silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the one in the back? Mrs. Alvarado flips to the back of the book and her mouth moves silently as she reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll probably do it in class. Mrs. Alvarado hands the book back to Alike and digs in to another celery stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're lovely. Of course your descriptiveness and use of alliteration is beautiful and all, you know that. But...I don't know. Is it your best? No. Alike frowns through the pages of the composition book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good. Not great. Alike slumps back into her seat and considers the book's cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you can go deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey is a heat-seeking missile, whipping through the sp hallways of the trauma wing, her clipboard and pen in constant motion. NURSES and AIDES scatter in her wake, suddenly busying themselves with little bits of chore wor avoid her caustic gaze. She barks at a cluster of CLERKS chatting in the elevator bank and all but one manage to escape. Audrey drills her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so your log is all up to date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've checked the round for any calls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you even know which doctors are on the floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ma'am I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I suggest you get busy. The clerk skitters off red-faced, and Audrey looks dagger into her back before storming the break room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey whisks her lunch bag out of the fridge and heads toward a table. A few lounging AIDES wad up their garbage flee the break room. Audrey settles down at the table and pulls a fashion magazine from her work tote, pretending n to be hurt. She peels open a cup of vanilla yogurt and be reading. A big red department store bag sits next to her tote. The television suspended over the table mumbles corporate healthcare infomercials. MRS. SINGLETARY, one o Audrey's co-workers swoops in and plops a plastic grocery on the table across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey girl! Mind if I sit here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not at all. Help yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatchu got there? You been shopping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Just some yogurt. Some vanilla yogurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I meant in the bag. What do you have in the shopping bag--the big red thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I'm...I don't know where my mind is...Yeah, this is just uh--well let me get your opinion. Audrey's steely exterior melts away and suddenly she is a butterflies and giggles. She rifles through the bag and hoists out a pink ribbed v-neck sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's nice. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah see isn't this cute? MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm-hmm. That's for your daughter? AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is for Alike. MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The youngest one. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No she's the oldest one. MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the other one. Okay. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you think it's too young? MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. For whatever reason the youngest one popped in my mind first. But I think it should be fine. It's really cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll compliment her figure. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now see that's what I thought... But Lee doesn't like anything I pick out for her anymore. Mrs. Singletary takes a bite of her lunch and takes the sweater from Audrey. MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, please. My oldest, 17 going on 27 mind you, banned me from buying her any more clothes. We have two completely different tastes. I just give her gift cards now and trust me, we're both happier for it. Is it her birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Singletary hands the sweater back to Audrey who smoo it carefully back into the tissue paper. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. I just wanted to get her something nice. You know. Three ROWDY CO-WORKERS burst into the room chattering and finger popping. ROWDY CO-WORKER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Brenda!

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Oooooh Audrey, you got me a     What'chall in here talkin present?                        about? AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no we-- MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of yo' damn business!! The co-workers hoot in unison and descend upon the variou parts of the breakroom. Audrey shoves the sweater back in bag and nestles it between her feet. Somebody cranks on a small radio and a frisky R&B beat invades the air. Mr Singletary pats Audrey on the arm. MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know how it goes. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I will. I'll call you when-- ROWDY CO-WORKER #3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bren' this is what I was telling you about!! Co-worker #3 shoves a tabloid in Mrs. Singletary's face, tapping an angry orange fingernail in the middle of the p MRS. SINGLETARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that her?!

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Told you!                       Look how big she done got The center of the room shifts and Audrey is once again al at the fringes. She collects her shopping bag and looks around to say goodbye, but no one notices her leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey, Sharonda, Alike, and their father, ARTHUR, 40- something with a used-to-be athletic build, are all gathe around the dinner table for a rare family dinner. Everyon takes half-hearted nibbles at their food avoiding eye con with each other. Sharonda picks at her food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see why we can't just watch TV like usual. Alike elbows Sharonda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't tell me what to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls. The phone rings and Arthur beats a path to bedroom to get Audrey wilts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm expecting a call. Audrey stares after him then glares back at Alike and Sharonda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your father's night off. Alike casts a glance in the direction of the bedroom, whe Arthur can be heard talking in hushed tones. She rolls he eyes and slinks down into her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So straighten up. Arthur settles back into his chair, his mood a little brighter. Seeing an opportunity for brownie points, Sharo pitches in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homecoming got moved this year. It's gonna be in September instead of October.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really? SHARONDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Which means I'll be able to go to Autumn Ball and the Homecoming Dance. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you going with? SHARONDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe Derek. If he asks me. Maybe Parrish. I haven't decided yet. But for homecoming, I definitely want to go with Craig. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, I see. Lee, who are you going with? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm. I'm not going. Arthur gives Alike an approving Daddy's girl wink. Alike beams back. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not going? This is your junior year. How can you not go? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
