dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Twist a virgin `round your dirty little finger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood is gone but the memory lingers...twist a virgin `round your bloody little finger, love is gone, but the memory lingers!" Alike is bobbing her head, backpack forgotten on her shoulder. Bina cranks the volume down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, this shit is hot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you. Don't you have to go? I'll cover. It's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I wanna stay. Alike slings her backpack to the floor and pulls the CD b into her lap. Her cell phone rings and she ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pier is a parade of mohawks, curly weaves, tight jean and rainbow belts as groups of baby dykes, young queens, gender queer youth of all shades of brown stroll cavort, strut seeing and wanting to be seen. Equally bedecked observers hoot and yell from bench and rail perches on bo sides. Laura jabs numbers into her cell phone. Competing threads of house music throb across the boardwalk in muff bursts as groups of ballers vogue and prance behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave a message and I'll call you back. BEEP. Laura yanks her phone away from her ear and looks at the screen. She starts to hang up but pulls it back to her ea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you at? Hit me up when you get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike and Bina are sprawled in the floor. Bina DJ's from laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Alvarado was trying to get me to check out this one place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike hands her the flyer. Bina laughs and tosses it back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hell, no. That's for old people-- I'll write down some places you should check out. Maybe you could read some of my stuff, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura scowls at her cell phone screen. She shoves the pho in her pocket and pulls her hoodie up against the chill o the evening. Brake lights bathe Laura and her circle of A in red as late-night predators cruise the strip for fresh meat. Laura catches sight of shady sexual encounters in a alley across the street and looks away. One of the entour passes Laura a joint and she inhales deeply. A few of the girls have backpacks and the group is pensive as they bre off and scatter into the night one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Member when we used to stay out here all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, used to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay with your sister now, huh? Laura nods and spits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AP English class is a safe haven. The desks are pulled together in a rough circle and are filled with heavily pierced, dyed hair, and vintage clothes types. Mrs. Alvar sits cross-legged atop her desk taking notes. Alike stand the center of the circle reciting an original poem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A butterfly, briefly Suffocated On the mucous of its own change Imprisoned

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the membranous chaff of its own underdeveloped Wings And Cramped In the darkness of the too-tight cocoon of its own creation Pauses Thinking death inevitable Prepares to die in the absolute solitude Of Swollen Husk. A c r a c k appears A thin jagged light connecting The inner to the outer world A butterfly, briefly Paralyzed by the imminence of death Discovers life is possible. The class claps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comments? Critiques? Julie, tell me what you think. A forest of hands go up as Alike winds her way back to he seat. A few classmates whisper brief encouragements. Bina nods and smiles at Alike. Unguarded, Alike smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bina and Alike troop home at a more leisurely pace. Alike breaks the silence for once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked your story, though. It was tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Which one? The one about the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one about karma, how things come back to you. That one, I thought it was tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real? Thanks. I wasn't gonna say anything, but I liked yours too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BINA
dialogues.text: Why did I like it or why wasn't I gonna say anything?

dialogues.speaker: ALIKE
dialogues.text: Why did you like it?

dialogues.speaker: BINA
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess because it felt honest.

dialogues.speaker: ALIKE
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: BINA
dialogues.text: Didn't you have on a different shirt earlier?

dialogues.speaker: ALIKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BINA
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: ALIKE
dialogues.text: No, what'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: BINA
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: ALIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I had on a different shirt.

dialogues.speaker: BINA
dialogues.text: Oh... Well, that's cool.

dialogues.speaker: ALIKE
dialogues.text: So why weren't you gonna say anything about it?

dialogues.speaker: BINA
dialogues.text: About your shirt?

dialogues.speaker: ALIKE
dialogues.text: About the poem.

dialogues.speaker: BINA
dialogues.text: Cause you're moody.

dialogues.speaker: ALIKE
dialogues.text: Moody?

dialogues.speaker: BINA
dialogues.text: And quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I'm not moody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Bina stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me. Alike looks up at the stoop, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so bad when there's some conversation, huh? Alike looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna come up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike sits on Bina's twin bed, looking around and really taking in the room for the first time. She reaches over a picks up a little molded soldier figure off of the shelf. Bina fishes around in a rack of CDs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave you this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the bear? My dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this. Alike holds the figurine out, Bina looks at it over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that. Girl, my stupid ex- boyfriend gave me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Cute. Bina opens a CD case and pulls the booklet out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I mean I guess it was at the time. Bina lobs the little army man into a trash can across the room and hands Alike the booklet. BINA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, this is the other artist I was telling you about. Her stuff is like, bouncier. A buoyant Afropunk beat wafts through the bedroom. Bina p down on the bed next to Alike. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is straight. You'll burn me a copy? BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have a bunch of other stuff, too. (beat) So who do you hang out with? I don't really see you with anybody. Alike shrugs and rifles through her backpack. She pulls o her composition book. Awkward silence. BINA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it like that. I was just asking because I was curious. I don't really like anybody that goes there either. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend Laura used to go there. Not now, but she's going back. BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh because, I was just gonna say-- I'm going to this house party and you can come if you want to. Bina waves her hand at the radio. BINA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They play this kind of music. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. How'm I supposed to dress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't dress. You just come however. Come as you are. Alike nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see? Bina snatches the book from Alike's hands and starts flip through pages before Alike can answer. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...But that's mainly old stuff, though. BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the one you did today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Bina offers the journal back to Alike. Alike reaches for Bina pulls it away at the last second--an impromptu game keep away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. Alike misses again. The girls crack up. BINA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, here. Bina yanks it away again. Alike gives up, still smiling. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play too much. BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, it's right here.     Just take it. Alike summons the courage for one last swipe. She manages grab it but Bina doesn't let go right away. The girls loc eyes during the extemporaneous tug-of-war. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome... Beaming with her victory, Alike busies herself with the journal. Bina recruits a small stuffed moose for her next foray. She dances the moose up Alike's arm and plants an exaggerated peck on her cheek with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmwaahhh! The girls erupt into renewed giggles. Bina tosses the stu animal aside and scoots closer to read over Alike's shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so private?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin', just my writings... Bina studies Alike's profile. She leans in and pecks Alik the cheek. Alike lets the kiss soak in, glancing at Bina sidelong. Bina leans in again, this time planting a long on Alike's lips. Alike pulls away. Bina tenses for the verdict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry. I just umm...I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Alike blindly grabs up her things and rushes the door, Bi flounders in her wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura and a group of friends play a rowdy game of spades. cute Puerto Rican girl is draped around Laura's neck like PERSONAL CHEERLEADER. Music blasts from the TV but doesn' drown out the hoots and banter of the rollicking entourag There is a knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get that for me? One of the friends breaks away from the pack, opens the d without greeting and walks away. Alike is left alone to escort herself in. Laura hardly looks up as Alike stops a the fringes of the pack. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wassup man. A collective grumble of greeting goes up around the table although no one addresses Alike directly. Laura slams the table and raises her hands in triumph. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Board, goddammit!! I told you! PIER GIRL #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww, we shoulda been done set you! Laura slaps hands with her partner. The unlucky pair of partners argue. The personal cheerleader kisses Laura on neck. Alike looks away. PERSONAL CHEERLEADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good game, baby! LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's good, Lee? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just came to say wassup. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatchu got, Ty? PIER GIRL #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, maybe four. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We goin' eight!! Roars of disbelief from around the table. Alike is quickl forgotten in the ruckus. Alike circles to Laura's side. T personal cheerleader looks her up and down. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you for a second? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I got to cut you!! Grab `em partner. We gonna run a Boston on that ass! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, I'm busy right now. More raucous laughter from the table. Alike endures anoth few moments of card slapping, table pounding dejection be leaning into Laura's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really need to talk to you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said later! Wide-eyed silence and scattered snickers around the table Laura resumes her hand and the game banter cranks back up Alike picks up her face and slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought that was your girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind your business. Bam! That's what I thought! Laura slaps another card on the table and takes a deep sw of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey lies awake in bed. The clock on the nightstand indicates a little past two in the morning. She looks at sliver of light underneath the bedroom door, the sound of Arthur's key in the door breaks the silence. Arthur's voi in hushed tones. Audrey rolls over and faces the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike watches her father's footsteps break up the light beneath her door. She tosses off her blankets and springs into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Dad! She is talking to empty air. She eases down the hallway toward the kitchen and the sound of his muffled voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on now, you know that's not what I want. That's not what I'm saying. That's not--listen to me. Are you gonna listen to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? Alike stops short outside the kitchen door, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee? Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike swings around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not you. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'll talk to you later, alright? My daughter's up. Arthur flips his cell phone shut and tucks it into his pocket. He fishes a beer out of the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that? Arthur sips his beer and walks over to the kitchen table. foil covered plate with a little pink sticky note waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you doing up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wanted to talk. Arthur crumples the sticky note and tosses it into the tr without reading it. He peels up one side of the foil, pee at the food underneath, and launches it into the trash, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, the plate--don't trash the plate. Arthur strips off his dress shirt and tie and flings them into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike rescues the plate from the garbage and carefully la it in the sink so it doesn't clatter. ALIKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you hungry? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ate already. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ate at work? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just grabbed some take out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Where? Arthur explodes. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you asking me all these goddamn questions, girl? What's wrong with you? You don't question me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Alike starts to head back to her room. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up. I'm sorry, Alike come on back. Look-- I got patties... Arthur tosses a greasy bag onto the table and pulls out a chair for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beef? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And chicken. C'mon. Alike sits happily and the two munch in silence for awhil ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen uh...Your momma's worried that uh...How's school? Straight A's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Want a sip? Arthur offers her the beer. Alike takes it to the head. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said a sip. A sip! Arthur snatches the beer from her. They laugh. Alike pick her patty, eating little pieces of crust. ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's on you your mind? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'. Arthur snorts. ALIKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if--what if...say somebody liked you right? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They like you? Or they like you, like you? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say they like you, like you. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, they haven't said anything yet. But what if... so what if the person is kinda like a friend, but you know they like you more than that? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think that's the best way to start--as friends. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then what if...What if the person is -- Arthur scents the heavy news packed in Alike's expressive pause and scrambles to intercept her at the pass. ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name? What grade is he in? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'ma look his ass up in the system. Ha-ha! Wait `till your mama finds out. She'll be so goddamn happy. Alike plays along, swallowing her disappointment. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Arthur pushes back from the table and pulls a fresh polic uniform out the hall closet. He lays it across the back o the couch and unzips his pants. Alike turns her back to g him privacy. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say uh--there's this new--uh women's club up there by the liquor store--have you--do you--you haven't heard anything about it, right? Alike shakes her head no. Arthur tucks his undershirt int his pants. ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Called the Kitty Litter, the Catbox, something like that? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I never even heard of it. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. `Cause you know that's a uh...it's a rough neighborhood. You know that right? I had a case over there. You wanna be careful--stay away from that element. Just in case it ever comes up? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be careful. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I know you will. Alike glances back at Arthur and sees that he's decent. S scoots back around to face him. Arthur smooths his unifor shirt into his pants. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, when you were on the phone earlier? It sounded like...I mean...I guess you're headed back to work, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Your mama still up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I had to work. Arthur picks up his work tote and kisses Alike on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura jams a pillow into a t-shirt as a makeshift pillowc as she escorts one of the pier girls to the couch. The pi girl looks slightly unkempt and is relieved to plop her knapsack on the floor. Laura tosses the pillow onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister gets home at six so, you gotta be gone by then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some lunchmeat in there too, help yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Preciate ya. Laura pulls up close to the kitchen table. The GED test p book, now dog-eared and worn is on the table in front of She finds her place and copies notes and multiple choice answers into a spiral notebook. A stack of old Math and English textbooks are in a chair next to her and the room peaceful and still save for the scratching of her pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike spies on Bina stuffing books into her locker. She d her breath and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. A long awkward silence. Alike leans against the bank of lockers, not daring to make eye contact. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about the other day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool. Bina pretends to rearrange books in her locker. ALIKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have been crazy. But look, I'm sorry I bugged out. It's just...I didn't know that you...I wasn't expecting that. BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still coming to the party? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know--I need to try and catch up with Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do wanna hang out...I mean...maybe we could do both. Bina smiles and shuts the locker door. BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. (beat) You could spend the night if want to. Avoid the whole curfew thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur coaches Alike as she navigates the car to a jerky in front of Mack's liquor store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, easy now. Watch your right hand side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ride the brakes though. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? I'm getting better!! Can I drive back? Arthur rubs his chest in mock heart-attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't about that. You're shaky girl, you're shaky. Get us some chips and I'll think about it. Arthur hands Alike a five dollar bill and she bounces dow out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur shouts a greeting to Mack who lounges on a plastic chair outside his door. Sock and TWO OTHER MEN chit chat nearby. Their chatter lowers as Arthur approaches. Alike into the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mr. Ferguson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see Alike's been running circles around you again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little bit, little bit. I still got it though. Arthur claps Mack on the shoulder and glimpses Sock whispering to one of the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur follows the men's gazes over to Alike at the potat chip rack. She twirls the string of her basketball shorts round and round her finger and idly hikes the collar of h shirt up over her nose. The smile evaporates from Arthur' face. Sock peers back at him, smirking. Arthur starts toward hi when Alike saunters out between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll holler at you later. Arthur crosses the lot in a bound, snatches the car keys Alike's hand, and hustles her into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said I could drive--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said get in the car! Alike frowns, then catches sight of the men in front of t store. She slumps into the car and slams the door. Arthur piles into the driver's seat. They sit in silence for a moment, Alike traces the lines in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...umm...you know you're daddy's girl, right? Alike avoids eye contact, staring out her window. Arthur searches her face a moment longer, then starts the car an pulls away in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey reclines on the couch reading a book. The doorknob jiggles and Audrey folds the book against her chest, pretending to be asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur slips in and lays his holster on an armchair, not bothering to approach Audrey's sleeping form. Arthur peeks inside the fridge and inspects one of Audrey foil covered plates. He tosses it aside and gathers sandw ingredients instead. Audrey yawns and props herself up on elbow. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you're home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must've dozed off. How long have you been in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hour. Dad takes a bite of his sandwich and shoves the ingredien back into the fridge. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the plate in there? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fine. Arthur plops down on an armchair and flips the TV channel sports highlights. Mom scoots over on the couch. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's room over here. You can see the TV better. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fine. Arthur props his feet up on the coffee table and catches Audrey's hurt expression. He winks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and your daughter. Have you talked to Lee yet? I told you she-- ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I talked to Alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. Like I told you. Matter fact, she's got a boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyfriend? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give her some space. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space? She's hardly ever home in the first place and you're just like her, creeping in all hours of the night. Both of you. Running around like you got something to hide, like I'm the big, bad witch and what about me? I'm home by myself all the time and Sharonda's getting older and starting to go out and pretty soon-- ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have anything to hide. Look I told you I talked to Alike and everything is fine. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ask her? Dad slams down his half-eaten sandwich and stands up. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, because I didn't have to. Besides,I would know okay? If anybody would know, it would be me. I know my daughter-- AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter?!! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --better than anyone else and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now all of a sudden she's just your daughter?!

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR AUDREY
dialogues.text: --I'm telling you she's just    Well I guess I better not fine!!                          have nothing else to say then, huh?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your damn problem, you're too much of a damn worry wart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope you're right, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you shut the fuck up?! Audrey jerks to her feet and flings the book aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An hour? Really? I'm not your dumb damn floozy in the street. And you will not talk to me that way. Audrey slaps the sandwich off Arthur's plate and storms t the bedroom. Arthur sees Sharonda peeking from her bedroo door but can't summon any words. Sharonda skitters into Alike's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike is awake, hands folded behind her head. Sharonda cu up on top of the covers next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're not scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. The girls lay silently as they listen to Arthur bang arou in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you know it doesn't matter to me. Alike rubs Sharonda's head and gives her a little squeeze

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOHAWKED WOMAN yowls into a microphone atop a coffee ta turned stage. Kids roam from room to room nursing plastic cups. Some in elaborate ensembles, some in thrift store d others in plain old jeans, but no two people the same. Al clad in simple shirt and jeans looks especially comfortab as she and Bina ease their way through the crowd. In betw performers, guitar riffs rock the large loft apartment an render their voices practically inaudible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Bina introduces Alike to different people, Alike is welcomed --Alike & Bina point out different performers, they l talk in each other's ears --Alike and Bina dance wildly in the middle of the crowd, surrounded by dozens of other clamorous bodies --One performer beckons Alike up onto the table, Alike de at first, then leaps on top of the table. Bina cheers. --Alike drags a giggling Bina out of the party and they c into the open night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights glisten across the Hudson River--distant orbs reflected in a thousand shimmering faux stars in weak defiance against the night sky. A sodium vapor glow veils everything in generous haloes, making the night more beautiful than it really is. Dancing silhouettes, laughing, playing, yelling, flying, always dancing silhouettes punctuate the summer breeze wi clapping set to the rhythm of soulful house. Like Puck on midsummer's night, like Peter Pan and his lost boys. Amon the silhouettes is Laura, enthroned atop a railing. Laura smoking a joint grandly, surrounded by an adoring circle, sycophantic harem of four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura, completely miserable as she watches two other silhouettes drawing closer, spinning, collapsing, now righting, always connected. Alike and Bina. Bina smiles a snakes her arms around Alike's neck. Alike too shy to rea giggles and folds. Laura watches the pair spin and passes the left before stalking off toward the connected shadows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura cuffs Alike on the neck, pulling Alike's hoodie up her face. Alike's laugh is tentative at first, not sure whether this is play or for real. Laura chuckles, breakin the ice. The pair slapbox and rough house, both missing w wild arcing blows. Laura aims a mini charge at Alike that lifts her off the ground and deposits her a short distanc away. Alike swipes Laura's hat. Laura claps Alike on the shoulder and Alike waves to Bina. Bina waves and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whatchu you think? She's cool right? Laura looks around and shrugs. Laura plucks a fresh joint of her coat and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's hot right? I told you. It was so tight. I'm tellin' you, you shoulda been there tonight! Laura takes a puff and offers it to Alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's just for me and you. Alike waves it off, oblivious and intoxicated with the ni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's smart, too. She does poetry, you should hear it. It's like, it's good, you know? Laura stops walking and Alike skips ahead, still chatteri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking next weekend the three of us could--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm right here. Alike snaps out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my bad, I thought you were beside me. Anyway, I was thinking-- LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry for all the drama. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's cool. I shoulda-- LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm saying is, I probably overreacted. (beat) And then...I don't know. Seeing you two together or whatever. I'm glad to see you're finally happy. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon man, you know you're my best friend. Nobody's gonna -- LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to say anything. I just wanted to get it off my chest. I'm happy for you, that's all. Alike shakes her head. Her mouth moves but nothing comes LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I love you, alright? And I'm sayin'...I'm right here. Alike is stopped cold, as the light bulb finally goes off Laura takes a long drag on the joint. Bina and Mika stumb over giggling. Bina hooks Alike's arm. Mika kisses Laura the neck. Laura snaps out of her gaze, her familiar smirk creeping back. MIKA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We goin' to get something to eat? LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what's up. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, umm-- Laura pinches out the joint and hands it to Mika who tuck away. LAURA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for later. Bina, nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. We had fun. Laura gives Bina a polite hug, pounds Alike on the should and starts to lead Mika away. MIKA                                 ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Byyeee!!                           Hey hold up! Laura pumps a lazy    fist in the air in acknowledgement. takes Alike's hand    and slowly drags her away. Alike ke looking back, then    finally gives up. Laura looks back Alike turns around    and disappears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your friends. They're cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music videos play on the TV. Alike and Bina lay stretched on pillows, a plate of brownie crumbs between them. Alike dozes. Bina smacks her with a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are. Alike rubs sleep out of her eyes and props herself up on elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any brownies left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Bina flicks off the TV and stares at Alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Alike looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike folds her arms behind her head. Bina strokes Alike' stomach. Her finger's dance at the top of Alike's pajama bottoms. Their eyes meet. Alike sits bolt upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is uh... I never... I'm sorry, I'm trippin' out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. We don't have to. Alike leans in and kisses Bina on the lips. Bina consider and takes Alike's chin in her hand and kisses her back. B places Alike's hand on her chest. Alike lets her hand lin then traces Bina's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura stands over the kitchen table shuffling through the mail. She pauses at a stiff envelope with her name on it. return address reads "NYS Educational & Testing Servi She flips the envelope over and looks around, she rips th top off and eases the top of a slip out of the envelope. top of the slip reads "'Campbell, Laura' GED TESTING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura shifts her weight on a painted concrete porch outsi small wooden frame home. The paint is peeling and the flo in the window-box are dead. A rusted metal mailbox next t the door overflows with circulars. Laura lifts the circul out of the box and trashes them. She picks up a discarded fast food bag and tosses it too. A dog barks from a neighboring yard. Laura pulls open the screen door and tr to peer in through the diamond shaped window in the main door, but it's covered over in aluminum foil. More barkin Laura surveys the street and bangs hard on the door. She snaps the screen door back and takes a big step backward. Laura shifts her weight and smooths her shirt. LAURA'S MOTHER, 54, and no-nonsense opens the door and frowns dow Laura through the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Laura's mother crosses her arms and looks at Laura up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you might've stepped out or something? How've you been? Laura's mother frowns up and down the block before refocu on Laura. Laura takes a step closer to the door. LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Candy, you know we're doing real good. Laura's mother puts her hand on the doorknob. LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might even be moving to a bigger place soon. You know she's workin' at the hospital now, yeah you'd be real proud of her. She might even go back and get her RN-- Laura takes another step forward. LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How--? How's Pops? You look good. You look healthy, yeah you look real good. You know uh, we miss you and everything-- Laura's mother starts to close the door. Laura backs away LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna take too much of your time. I just stopped by--you know I uh--I'm getting my stuff together too--I uh-- Laura fishes the stiff envelope out of her pocket and advances on the screen door again, holding it out. LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I did it. I took the test and-- Laura's mother slams the door. Laura stands on her tiptoe and yells at the diamond shaped window. LAURA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my GED! The lock on the door snaps into place. Renewed barking fr across the street. Silence from the door. Laura brushes a fist across her eyes and stuffs the envelope into the mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But listen I--I gotta go. I gotta get to work but I'ma leave it for you to see. It was nice talking to you. Laura backs off the porch and starts down the walkway. Sh stops halfway and bounds back onto the porch. She yanks t envelope out of the mailbox and jams it into her pocket. Laura storms off the porch and out of yard, never looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike is asleep on the bed. Bina cleans up feverishly, "accidentally" bumping Alike awake. Alike yawns and rolls over, a huge grin spreading across her face as she rememb her surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Bina bolts to the dresser and crams clothes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You up already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's after one o'clock, actually. Bina deposits an armful of clothes into the dirty clothes hamper, and then begins making the bed with Alike still i it. Alike pulls Bina down beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin's wrong, I'm just cleaning up. Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then, I'll help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I got it. Bina snatches a pillow from behind Alike and fluffs it. Alike, still oblivious, grins and traces Bina's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look um--I just wanted to say that last night...last night was amazing...thank you for-- BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night we were just playin' around, that's all. Bina flinches away from Alike's touch. Alike shoots a gla at the door and drops her voice to a choked whisper. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... We can slow things down... Nobody has to know that we're together. BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Together"? Whoa, no... ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?! I thought... Look if you don't want to call it that, that's fine, but don't act like nothing happened. Bina moves away and levels her gaze at Alike for the firs time. Alike touches Bina's elbow, Bina flinches away. BINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not gay okay? This isn't me--I wasn't--I'm not ready for all this... Alike recruits the discarded stuffed moose and dances it around on the bed. Bina recoils and snatches it away. Recognition seeps across Alike's pained face. Bina moves from the bed and turns her back on Alike. Alike finds her pajama pants on the floor and yanks them She pulls on jeans over her pajama bottoms and hauls a sweatshirt down over her nightie. She flings her backpack open on the bed and hunts around the room wildly gatherin her things. Alike goes in the bathroom and reappears with armful of toiletries, dumping them in the bag. Bina watch her, arms folded. Alike takes one last look around the ro and heads for the door, running a sleeve across her face. BINA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee? Alike ignores her and launches into the hallway.   Bina r to her bedroom doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait--Lee?! Alike beelines for the front door. Bina chases Alike acro the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee, stop please? Alike wipes a sleeve across her swelling eyes and running nose and turns to face her. Bina takes several steps towa her. Alike lets go of the doorhandle, her voice cracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise you won't tell anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike rages outside, weaving blind fury down the sidewalk She kicks over a cluster of garbage cans and cyclones out into the street, narrowly missing getting hit by a car. S continues her zag to the other sidewalk, her pace quicken She rips open her backpack and launches a baseball cap in the air. She tears a handful of wifebeaters from the bag flings them into the street. Spinning and thrashing she wrenches out a football jersey and jams it into another garbage can. She circles back and kicks the can over. She hurtles her backpack into the trees like a discus and she her hoodie like a skin before disappearing into the screa a subway station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee bursts into the living room and charges to her bedroo Audrey, who has been waiting in the living room storms in after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where in the hell have you been?! Alike kicks off her shoes and paces the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me talking to you ?! Where you been? You left Bina's hours ago!!!! Lee--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey gasps in stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your husband so stop comin' at me like I am. I'm not your companion, I'm not your friend -- you made that abundantly clear--I'm your daughter and I have my own shit to deal with!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEE--don't you dare--Alike--I am your Mother-- Audrey melts back against the doorjamb. Alike slings off shirt and slams the door in Audrey's face. A livid Audrey bangs on the door and jiggles the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have lost your damn mind! Wait until your father gets home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike attacks her closet, ripping all the "girly" shirts the hangers and hurling them toward a small vanity trashc She plunges back in and slams an armful of blouses to the floor. She launches a pair of pumps into the wall, follow by a chunky pair of Timberlands. Silent sobs rack her bod she tears off her own shirt and slings it at the mirror. strips off her jeans and kicks them brutally into a corne Alike considers her unclothed form in the mirror before collapsing onto the bed. She writhes against the pillows covers her eyes with her elbow as darts of grief twist through her body. Blackout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike jerks awake in her bed, a pillow pulled down around ears. The sound of a muffled argument leaks from her parents's bedroom. The shouting gets louder, and Alike si upright in her bed as her father's footsteps boom past he doorway and into the living room. Audrey's voice trails h down the hallway, and Alike scrambles into a t-shirt and shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur's hand is on the doorknob, a small tote flung over shoulder. Audrey blocks the door, her hands on her hips. both look up as Alike edges into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, that's exactly what I'm talking about?! Get over here! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to bed! AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you come tell your father what you told me! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't drag her into this, Audrey! (to Alike) Go to your room, Alike. Your mom and I are having a discussion. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not discussing!! I wanna know right now-- ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to your room! AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's leaving us!! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not leaving you!! AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharonda, wake up!! Come see your father leaving us!! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not fucking leaving!! Will you stop saying that?! AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come say goodbyeeee!! Audrey shoves Arthur toward the door. Reflexively, Arthur raises his hand at Audrey. Audrey puffs up. AUDREY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what?! I wish you would!! Go ahead!! Look girls, your daddy's going to beat me!! Sharonda bursts into tears behind Alike. Alike hurries Sharonda back down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. It's okay. Go in my room and lock the door. Don't come out, `kay? Sharonda bawls harder. Alike gently closes the door on he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Audrey argue viciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Dammit, that's not true! Look, will you stop sayin' that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth!! Alike edges back into the living room, Audrey wheels on h Arthur is beaten and cornered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daddy's got a new girlfriend! Or did you already know that?! You know, I bet you did!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey, stop it!! Alike go back to bed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, your daughter's turning into a damn man right before your very eyes, and you can't even see it!! Arthur drops his tote and advances toward Audrey, levelin stiff finger at her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you take that back.! You shut the fuck up about that, Audrey! Arthur gets in Audrey's face. Audrey leers back at him. A jumps between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to bed, Alike!! AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him, Lee! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call her Lee! ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, stoppit please!? AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your Dad where you hang out! Tell him about your butch-ass girlfriend-- ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura's NOT my girlfriend!! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?! You don't know what the hell are you talking about. Alike, please just go to your room, baby! Alike drops her gaze and backs away. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him! Arthur's expression cracks and he tears his focus from Au to Alike. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what?! ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not tellin' you nothin'. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him you're a dyke! You tell him you're a nasty ass dyke!! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No she's not gay. Alike we didn't raise you that way, baby. Eyes still downcast, Alike just shakes her head and backs away. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!! You see!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shut the hell up Audrey!! Arthur extends his arms toward Alike, his voice trembling ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that's not true. You tell your mother right now, Alike. You tell her it isn't true!! Alike meets her father's eyes. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad-- ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you lie now, you tell the truth!! ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already know. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't know. You tell your mother it's just a phase. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a phase! Arthur is stopped cold, his shoulders slump. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, if you would've DONE

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alike) What's wrong with you? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with me! AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your fault!! If you had-- Arthur tears into Audrey, spittle flying. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY ARTHUR
dialogues.text: DON'T YOU SCREAM AT ME!! You    This is NOT my fault!! Ju should've been at home more     shut up and lemme talk! I often!! Why don't you DO        trying to fuckin' talk--

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING
dialogues.text: ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: YEAH I'M GAY
dialogues.text: Arthur spasms as though he's been stabbed. Out of nowhere Audrey's backhand pistons Alike to the ground. She raises hand high and slaps it down hard on Alike's shoulders and arms. Alike yells. Arthur turns to stone. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again! Say it again! Alike fends off Audrey's blows with her hands. She kicks angrily as Audrey towers over her. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a lesbian! Yeah, I'm a dyke. AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not!!!!! Audrey's blows become more manic and vicious. Arthur wake from his trance and tries to wrestle Audrey off of Alike. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough! Stop it! AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you say that! Let go! Don't you say that! ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get offa me!! AUDREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You a man now? YOU GON' FIGHT

dialogues.speaker: ME LIKE A MAN
dialogues.text: Audrey swings and hits Alike with a nasty hook to the jaw Alike's head snaps back and hits the floor. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY STOP
dialogues.text: Arthur yanks Audrey off of Alike. Audrey directs her rage him, pummeling his face and chest.

dialogues.speaker: GOD
dialogues.text: Tears stream down Arthur's face as Audrey shakes free and aims one last blow at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click-clack. Click-clack. The rattle of circuit breakers through the bare darkness of Laura's small apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Click-clack. Click-clack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Fucking building. Laura bangs into something in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww. Shit! A small light flicks to life and grows larger. In its dim glow, Laura spots Alike leaning against a worn couch. The lights become two as Laura hands Alike a candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Good thing I keep some these around. Alike snorts thickly. Her words are slurred and nasal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, for your many women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you thanking `em now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura holds her candle up to Alike's grim face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Alike wipes at already dried tear streaks on her puffy fa and looks down. Laura slides an arm around her waist and guides her into the small bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh-uh. I stopped by the house--I stopped by---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright, man. You can wear some of mine. It's okay, c'mon. Lets get some sleep. My sister'll be home in a little bit, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overturned Ramen noodle cups litter the floor. Laura sips beer and strokes Alike's head who sleeps fitfully in her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur is frozen in the middle of the living room with a contractor trash bag. He stoops and piles the shards of a broken lamp into the bag one by one. Sharonda peeks out a him from her bedroom door. Arthur looks up at her and Sharonda pushes the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey sits at the edge of her bed in a housecoat. Her ha is ruffled and flyaway. Her ankles are crossed and her ha are dead birds in her lap. Her work clothes are laid out neat line beside her: shirt, pants, socks, and shoes on t floor right underneath. The telephone begins to ring, but Audrey does not hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bina and a HIGH SCHOOL BOY sit on the floor, their backs propped against the bed, books spread on the floor. The b puts his arm around Bina, launching numerous passionate advances, but Bina pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clueless boy continues his clumsy attempts. Bina star out the window, completely detached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey, still in her housecoat, stares into the refrigera transfixed by the mountain of foil-covered plates. Her ey are cried-out buttons. Suddenly she remembers to breathe, her breaths come raggedly tearing out fresh tears. She ya a foil-covered plate, dumps its contents into the trash c and tosses the plate into the sink. She dumps another and another, her composure returning with each plate tossed. the time she gets to the last one, her breathing slows an returns to normal. She disappears into the bedroom and reappears with the red shopping bag. She calmly lifts out pink blouse and stuffs it into the garbage. She wads up t shopping bag and stuffs it in too. She takes a deep breat and wipes her sleeve across her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, Audrey and Sharonda are pegged around the dinner table. Audrey's make-up fails to cover the dark circles beneath her eyes and Arthur has a week's worth of stubble There is a jagged hole where Alike usually sits. Noticing the asymmetry, Audrey bundles up Alike's place setting an sweeps it onto the floor. Sharonda looks from Audrey to Arthur then into her plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to say grace? Arthur clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavenly Father... Audrey thrusts her hands out to Arthur and Sharonda.   Th each take her hand and Arthur begins again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Heavenly Father we pray... we pray thank you for this food and we pray... we pray for your continued blessing... Arthur stops talking but his head remains bowed. An awkwa silence ensues. Audrey and Sharonda look up at him still holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. Audrey switches to an overly cheery auto-pilot mode, babb to no one in particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got this recipe from a magazine. Supposed to be very good. And you see I made those green beans you like. Sharonda pass the rice please. Sharonda, staring at her father doesn't reach for the bow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad. You know where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike and Laura sit at the edge of the roof sharing a qua of mint chocolate chip ice cream. Sunset paints the citys pink and orange. The faint cadence of children playing dr in and out on a fickle breeze. Alike's wounds are healing she seems happy. The friends exchange wordless smiles and soak in the peacefulness around them. Laura hears a noise at the door and gets up to investigat Arthur is standing in the doorway. Laura calls out to Ali Alike looks up and the smile fades from her face. Arthur tries to move around Laura, but Laura stares him down. La looks back at Alike. Alike considers, then carefully nods Laura steps out of the way and watches Arthur pass. Alike rises to face her father. She stands tall, her weig is centered. Arthur struggles to find her eyes, and she t away from him. Distant playground voices fill the pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike sits at the edge of the roof writing in her noteboo Laura swings open the door and Alike looks back in greeti her smile fading as Arthur appears behind her. Laura moti to Alike. Alike considers, then carefully nods. Laura ste aside and watches Arthur pass. Alike wanders to the edge of the roof, Arthur follows. Distant playground voices fill the pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mom? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She...your mother couldn't make it. Alike shakes her head and peers into the rusty skyline. Arthur slumps his hands in his pockets and edges closer. ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember our old place? Waaay out in Queens? It was our first apartment, we were so proud. Had all those trees around it? In October, the whooole block would be covered with leaves. You remember. Alike makes no sign. ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldnt've been more than 2 years old. And when the wind would blow, all those leaves would come rushing down the street at us and you thought they were alive. You'd get so scared. You'd cry and you'd scream and beg for us to pick you up. I would try and tell you "they're only leaves, baby" and make you stay on the ground. But you were so afraid and you cried so hard, your mother would always pick you up. She always picked you up. Arthur is silent beneath the weight of his memory. He dar glance over at Alike. ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Member how we used to-- ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been accepted into a early college program. Starts in the Spring. Berkeley. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: California's a long way away-- ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten weeks writing boot camp, workshops. Then I can start summer semester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can talk about that. Okay? ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to meet with my guidance counselor. Sign the paperwork so I can graduate early. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, alright? I'm sorry I let her hurt you-- ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know now if you'll sign the papers. Yes or no? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes or no? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can always come back home. Things are gonna be different, I promise you-- Alike holds Arthur's hand, stopping him. ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm not running. I'm choosing. Arthur's heart breaks, he gasps back a sob. ALIKE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (beat) Okay. Alike nods, squeezes Arthur's hand. Arthur breathes deepl composing himself. He starts to pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better-- ALIKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Mom that she was right. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God doesn't make mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should tell her yourself. Arthur squeezes Alike's hand and drifts away. Alike inhal the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey is cleaned up, well-dressed and freshly put togeth She sits alone at the lunch table, crunching an apple. A bible and a daily devotional guide are spread open in fro of her. Alike knocks on the glass, and Audrey looks up stunned. Alike comes in and sits across from her. Audrey glances around, concerned about passing coworkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee--Alike. How've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Did Dad tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? Audrey gathers her lunch garbage and pushes back from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope you're keeping yourself safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Mom. Audrey stacks her devotional guide on top of her bible an stands. She starts to speak, then crosses to the door instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be praying for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey disappears into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike writes in her notebook, mouthing the words to a poe She looks up and studies the horizon from time to time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alike relaxes at a desk, reading from her notebook. Mrs. Alvarado sits cross-legged on her desk listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heartbreak opens onto the sunrise For even breaking is opening And I am broken I am open Broken to the new light without pushing in Open to the possibilities within pushing out See the love shine in through my cracks See the light shine out through me? I am broken I am open I am Broken Open See the love-light shining through me Shining through my cracks Through the gaps My Spirit takes journey My Spirit takes flight Could not have risen otherwise And I am not Running I am Choosing Running is not a Choice From the Breaking Breaking is freeing Broken is freedom I am not broken I am free. Alike closes her book. The pair reflect in easy silence. Alvarado nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The downtown Brooklyn landscape hums against the windshie as Arthur and Alike ride in complete silence. Sharonda ch a thumbnail, peering over the backseat. Laura slumps agai the window, a smirk hiding at the corner of her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura and Sharonda fumble a suitcase out of the trunk of car. Alike shrugs into her backpack. Arthur nudges them a and hefts out the rest of the luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. Arthur slams the trunk shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to come in with you? Alike shakes her head. Arthur starts to back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-- Alike pounces on Arthur in a surprise hug. Arthur squeeze her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can always come back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General chaos as passengers, and well-wishes scramble for position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get a hug or somethin', damn. Laura squeezes Alike first with one arm then pulls her ha out of her pocket to wrap both arms around her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call us when you get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I will. Laura backs away and wipes a sleeve at her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just better fuckin' call. Alike disappears through the bus doors. Laura slouches on hydrant and Sharonda paces, scanning the windows for Alik

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharonda waves maniacally. Alike musters a smile and puts hand on the window. Laura raises a fist. The bus sails aw from the curb. Alike leans forward to keep Laura and Sharonda in sight a long as possible. As she faces front again, she glimpses Arthur, standing in the doorway of the terminal. A passin van blots him from view and she leans back in her seat. A OLD KOREAN WOMAN next to her offers her a piece of ginger candy. Alike pops the candy into her mouth and takes a de breath. Reflections of the retreating city landscape replay acros Alike's face and she is able to hold back neither the smi nor the tears that come.
